item.title: How to add SafePK?
item.dc:creator: @Kalphiter Kalphiter
item.description:
@Kalphiter wrote:

[quote=“army_life, post:3, topic:220140”]Are you meaning Safe zone?

step 1: Go into your client.java
step 2: press Ctrl F
step 3: Type in

public boolean nonWild() {

Should see something similar to this

if ((absX >= 3249 && absX <= 3258 && absY >= 3438 && absY <= 3431) || (absX >= 3343 && absX <= 3348 && absY >= 3356 && absY <= 3537) || (absX >= 2600 && absX <= 2700 && absY >= 3600 && absY <= 3750) || (absX >= 2700 && absX <= 2800 && absY >= 4700 && absY <= 4800) || (absX >= 3000 && absX <= 3200 && absY >= 9800 && absY <= 9950) || (absX >= 2500 && absX <= 2700 && absY >= 3400 && absY <= 3500) || (absX >= 2500 && absX <= 2700 && absY >= 3000 && absY <= 3500) || (absX >= 2300 && absX <= 2700 && absY >= 5000 && absY <= 5600) || (absX >= 3250 && absX <= 3320 && absY >= 2752 && absY <= 2807) || (absX >= 3207 && absX <= 3225 && absY >= 3498 && absY <= 3506) || (absX >= 2730 && absX <= 2845 && absY >= 3460 && absY <= 3575) || (absX >= 3229 && absX <= 3242 && absY >= 9796 && absY <= 9807) ||

it comes out different on here it can be in almost any order but find the last

||

add this

(absX >= SWX && absX <= NEX && absY >= SWY && absY <= NEY) ||

The SWX stands for the South West X coord. Add that there.
The NEX stands for the North East X coord. Add that there.
The SWY stands for the South West Y coord. Add that there.
And the NEY stands for the North East Y coord. Also add that there.

Make sure that what I just gave you matches the pattern on yours to keep it organized.[/quote]Blargh idiots’ way of safe zones…

(absX >=X1 && absY >=Y1 && absX <=X2 && absY <=Y2)||
Therefor it’s simple.

Read full topic

item.title: How to add SafePK?
item.dc:creator: @army_life army_life
item.description:
@army_life wrote:

Are you meaning Safe zone?

step 1: Go into your client.java
step 2: press Ctrl F
step 3: Type in

public boolean nonWild() {

Should see something similar to this

if ((absX >= 3249 && absX <= 3258 && absY >= 3438 && absY <= 3431) || (absX >= 3343 && absX <= 3348 && absY >= 3356 && absY <= 3537) || (absX >= 2600 && absX <= 2700 && absY >= 3600 && absY <= 3750) || (absX >= 2700 && absX <= 2800 && absY >= 4700 && absY <= 4800) || (absX >= 3000 && absX <= 3200 && absY >= 9800 && absY <= 9950) || (absX >= 2500 && absX <= 2700 && absY >= 3400 && absY <= 3500) || (absX >= 2500 && absX <= 2700 && absY >= 3000 && absY <= 3500) || (absX >= 2300 && absX <= 2700 && absY >= 5000 && absY <= 5600) || (absX >= 3250 && absX <= 3320 && absY >= 2752 && absY <= 2807) || (absX >= 3207 && absX <= 3225 && absY >= 3498 && absY <= 3506) || (absX >= 2730 && absX <= 2845 && absY >= 3460 && absY <= 3575) || (absX >= 3229 && absX <= 3242 && absY >= 9796 && absY <= 9807) ||

it comes out different on here it can be in almost any order but find the last

||

add this

(absX >= SWX && absX <= NEX && absY >= SWY && absY <= NEY) ||

The SWX stands for the South West X coord. Add that there.
The NEX stands for the North East X coord. Add that there.
The SWY stands for the South West Y coord. Add that there.
And the NEY stands for the North East Y coord. Also add that there.

Make sure that what I just gave you matches the pattern on yours to keep it organized.
